message.content:
First, we extract the key numbers from the three statements. (Note: In the absence of non‐current liabilities, we take Total Liabilities as the Total Current Liabilities.)

─────────────────────────────  
1. From the Balance Sheet (all “End_amount” numbers as of 2024‑01‑29):

• Cash on Hand = 4,540,900.90  
• Bank Deposits = 2,866,063.83  
• Interest Receivable = 8,967.44  
• Accounts Receivable = 1,851,327.29  
• Inventory = 450,000.00  
• Total Current Assets = 9,717,259.46  
• Fixed Assets = 5,528,936.17  
• Accumulated Depreciation = 45,749.47  
• Total Non‑current Assets = 5,483,186.70  
• Total Assets = 15,200,446.16  

Liabilities & Owners’ Equity:  
• Accounts Payable = 1,240,000.00  
• Taxes Payable = 253,246.99  
• Total Current Liabilities = 1,493,246.99  
• Paid‑in Capital = 13,000,000.00  
• Retained Earnings = 707,199.17  
• Total Owner’s Equity = 13,707,199.17  

─────────────────────────────  
2. From the Cash Flow Statement:

Operating activities:  
• Net Profit = 707,199.17  
• Depreciation = 45,749.47  
• (Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable = –1,851,327.29  
• (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable = –8,967.44  
• (Increase) Decrease in Inventory = –450,000.00  
• Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable = 1,240,000.00  
• Increase (Decrease) in Tax Payable = 253,246.99  

• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –64,099.10  

─────────────────────────────  
3. From the Income Statement:

• Main Business Revenue = 5,064,939.23  
• Total Revenue = 5,064,939.23  
• Cost of Goods Sold = 2,735,000.00  
• Gross Profit = 2,329,939.23  
• Total Expenses (Admin, Selling, Depreciation & Financial Expenses) = 1,378,460.51  
• Interest Income = 8,967.44  
• Profit Before Tax = 960,446.16  
• Tax Expense = 253,246.99  
• Net Profit = 707,199.17  

─────────────────────────────  
Now, let’s compute each ratio step by step:

1. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
   = (Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities) / (Total Current Liabilities)  
   = (–64,099.10) / (1,493,246.99)  
   ≈ –0.0429  
   Rounded to two decimals: –0.04  

2. Debt to Equity Ratio  
   (Assuming only current liabilities represent debt)  
   = Total Liabilities / Total Owner’s Equity  
   = (1,493,246.99) / (13,707,199.17)  
   ≈ 0.1089  
   Rounded to two decimals: 0.11  

3. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
   = Total Revenue / Total Assets  
   = 5,064,939.23 / 15,200,446.16  
   ≈ 0.333  
   Rounded to two decimals: 0.33  

4. Quick Ratio  
   (Quick Assets = Current Assets excluding Inventory)  
   = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits + Interest Receivable + Accounts Receivable) / Total Current Liabilities  
   First, sum the quick assets:  
   = 4,540,900.90 + 2,866,063.83 + 8,967.44 + 1,851,327.29  
   = 9,267,259.46  
   Then:  
   = 9,267,259.46 / 1,493,246.99  
   ≈ 6.208  
   Rounded to two decimals: 6.21  

5. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
   (This is essentially the same as Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio)  
   = –64,099.10 / 1,493,246.99  
   ≈ –0.04  

6. Return on Equity (ROE)  
   = (Net Profit) / (Total Owner’s Equity)  
   = 707,199.17 / 13,707,199.17  
   ≈ 0.0516, i.e. 5.16% when expressed as a percentage  

7. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
   (Calculated as Revenue divided by average accounts receivable. Since initial AR was 0 and end AR is 1,851,327.29, the average AR = (0 + 1,851,327.29)/2.)  
   Average Accounts Receivable = 1,851,327.29 / 2  
   = 925,663.645  
   
   Then,  
   Accounts Receivable Turnover = Main Business Revenue / Average Accounts Receivable  
   = 5,064,939.23 / 925,663.645  
   ≈ 5.47  

─────────────────────────────  
Now, we provide the results in the required JSON output format.

{
  "solution": {
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-0.04",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.11",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.33",
    "Quick Ratio": "6.21",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.04",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "5.16%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "5.47"
  }
}
